cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi ESE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continues west then west-southwest toward the lower Texas coast before moving inland into northern Mexico

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Louisiana coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Port Mansfield to Mesquite Bay TX; Tropical-Storm Warning: Barra el Mezquital MX to Port Mansfield TX and Mesquite Bay to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Lower and middle Texas coast, with rain bands extending to the upper Texas and Louisiana coasts
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts 20-30 mph possible as outer rain bands brush southeast Louisiana, but sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal water level rises (<2 ft) possible mainly at east-facing beaches; no significant surge expected in the Mississippi River or port facilities.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain, total 3-5 inches, locally higher, could lead to ponding on terminal yards and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along Gulf beaches; brief low-end tornado risk in outer rain bands cannot be ruled out.
